description: This striking color and trim combination highlights a well taken care of Ferrari that is ready to enjoy. This car is documented by a clean California title, a clean Carfax Report, the original owner's manuals and a comprehensive service history including a major service performed in September 2016. The major service  included timing belts, cam seals, accessory belts, tensioners, new oil, transmission fluid and brake flush at a cost of $ 6970. Also with the car is the original tools, a battery tender system, and a car cover.   Additionally a new soft top was installed this last February.   The car starts easily and runs strongly with no issues or deferred maintenance. The paint and interior are in very good condition and show the wear you would expect from a 31 year old car. All systems including the power windows and air conditioning fully operate.    Financing is available with rates starting at 2.99% APR with approved credit. We can also arrange shipping anywhere and coordinate independent inspections.

title: 1985 Ferrari 308 GTSI

description: Gateway Classic Cars  Orlando Florida  showroom is proud to present this 1977 Ferrari 208 Coupe for sale. Introduced at the Geneva Motor Show in 1975, the 208 GT4 was a low-displacement version of the V8 produced for the Italian market, where cars with engines larger than two litres were subjected to a doubled VAT (38%). The engine was de-bored to (66.8x71 mm) 2.0 L (1991 cc) V8, resulting in the smallest production V8 in history for a road car.Power output is 170 PS (125 kW) at 7700 rpm for a top speed of 137 mph (220 km/h). Smaller Weber 34 DCNF carburetors, a lower final drive ratio and skinnier tires completed the technical changes for the 208. Chrome (rather than black) accents outside and the lack of fog lights were external visual indicators of the smaller-engined GT4. Inside the 208 GT4 featured a black rather than silver dash facing. If you are truly looking for a rare and collectible Ferrari call now before some collector scoops it up. This 1977 Ferrari 208 can be seen, including an HD video, at www.gatewayclassiccars.com, call at 407-771-2000 or Email orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com for more information. See more at : http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1977/ferrari/208-S933.html
title: 1977 Ferrari 208

description: Motorcar Studio is pleased to offer this 1975 Ferrari (Dino) 308GT4. Silver/Boxer over black and blue interior. 69k miles. A very original and honest car with a known long-term ownership history and good service records. With the same North Carolina owner from 1988 until 2011 (it was a birthday gift from his wife) and then with a collector in Atlanta until our acquisition earlier this year.

We just completed a belt service with Hill Engineering bearings and fitted a new set of Vredestein Sprint Classics on the original Campagnolo wheels. We also serviced the A/C and it is currently blowing cold. Runs, drives and sounds great (see video) -- there really is no substitute for a carbureted Ferrari and this one feels well sorted and put together.

We believe the paint to be mostly original (the silver at least) and in presentable condition -- there are a few flaws and some light checking on the top sides but it looks too good to warrant a repaint. Likewise the interior presents well with only minor wear on the outer driver bolster. Engine is dry, gearbox feels good (even second gear) and it's tidy underneath. Owner's manual and tools are included. Aside from the mirrors, Vitaloni units likely installed in period, the car is all stock and unmolested with the early Dino details intact. A great driver that has been well cared for and offered at an approachable price point.
For more information on this 1975 Ferrari 308 GT4 for sale at Motorcar Studio in Atlanta, please call 404-692-5250.
title: 1975 Ferrari 308 GT4

description: 1983 Ferrari 308 GTS QuattrovalvoleLocated in Longueuil QuebecRecently Reduced price of 39900Beautiful All Original Car in Excellent ConditionAll Original Convertible 308 with Black Targa Top179 Cubic Inch V8 230 HP EngineManual 5 Speed Transmission 30200 MilesRepainted Ferrari Red Tan Leather InteriorMajor 30000 service done on schedule at dealershipAll Paperwork Available Owners Manual and toolsNew Coolant TankNew BeltsSerial Number. ZFFMA13A6D0048215Looks and Drives Great30200 miles245hp v8rear wheel drivegasolineConvertible Targa topManual transmissionRed exteriorLeather Tan interiorElectric windowsElectric locksElectric mirrorsAMFM StereoOriginal owners manual tools and jack.All original car except for the paint.Car was repainted sometime before I purchased it 6.5 years ago but it looks fantastic.All service records since I owned it.A copy of the carfax that I got when I purchased the car.The windows are very slow as it is for every other Ferrari 308 out there. I have been meaning to get the motors changed and everything inside the door greased with a modern grease but have not had the time to do so. The overflow tank and the belts have been replaced. The car has had it's 30000 mile service includes the timing belt The paint I have only recently discovered is not original. The car has been repainted but it looks fantastic. All the switches work except for the electric aerial but that is the actual unit and not the switch itself. Have not been able to find a replacement aerial yet so I have put in a manual aerial for now so I can still listen to the radio. AC works but is not very strong same as it is for all other 308s. Headlights work perfectly. No rust no dents no scratches. There are a couple small nicks in the paint under the front bumper from the road hard to see unless you are lying on the ground looking at the car. No leaks doesn't smoke or burn any oil. The tires have good tread. I have never had any problems with the fuse box so I have never replaced it. The tape deck no longer functions but the radio works fine.Qualified buyers may be eligible to apply for financing and nationwide shipping.

description: 1979 California Daytona Spyder

Here is a beautiful California Daytona Spyder Factory Built on a 1979 Corvette Chassis. It is a one owner and it took about 4 years from the time he order it to get everything completed on it. It is #79 0f 79 Built. Pretty cool to have the last one off the assembly line…;-)  The Original spent over $30K on this car and order it with every possible option that he could. This car was his baby as you will see. It has spent all of its life in the garage. With Only 5,800 Original Miles on it from when the car was redone back in 1996. This is the car that was designed for Miami Vice TV Show and boy did it cause a lot of controversy when it came out.
Check out my store for more great Unique and Classic Cars.
Make sure and check out the Video below.

This car runs great runs great and is so much fun to cruise around it with the Top down. The previous owned was my jeweler that custom made my Gold rings. He passed away about a year ago. His wife caled me up and asked if I could help here sell his cars. He was a very meticulous man that always made sure that everything was fixed properly and taken care of right away.

The exterior of this car is beautiful.The Ferrari Red Paint is in great condition. There are a couple of little chips/scuff marks from driving it. All of the Chrome Trim and Exhaust Tips shine like there is no tomorrow. The Convertible Top is in Great Shape and does not leak or anything like that. It has Eagle ZR50 Goodyear Tires with about 50% or so tread left. The back wheels are staggered a little compared to the front wheels.
Options:
Factory Build
383 Stroker Engine
4 Speed 700R4 Automatic Transmission
Leather
Factory AC
Carbon Fiber Back Springs
After Market Tape Deck
Pioneer 6X9 Four Way Speakers
McBurnie Wheels,

The interior he had Custom Made for him. The Black Leather Seats are just about as comfortable as you can get and feel like they just kinda snuggle you right in for a nice and comfortable ride. There are no holes, rips or tears that I could find in the car. It has VDO Gauses that all function properly. It has an After Market Tape Deck and Pioneer 6X9 Speakers in the back.
This car is just a rare beauty that you won't find another one of. I have owned a few of these obver the years and this is probably the nicest one I have seen...;-)

I took pictures of every detail of this car so you can get the full picture and know exactly what you are getting. If there is any other questions or any other pictures you would like please let us know.
Call anytime with questions…. Nathan 406-544-6919
Current Mileage:  5,800

Vehicle Disclosures of Condition:  There are a few blemishes in the paint. Couple of paint chips/scratches. Chrome on wheels is chipping some. Drivers head rest need fixed. Hood struts need replaced.  May need a tune up. This is a classic car that may be in need of some restoration.
